name: International Justice Mission
description:
International Justice Mission (IJM) is a Washington D.C.-based, Christian, non-profit organization which works globally to help provide justice for the poor.

The Texas A&M chapter of IJM, is a group of socially conscious Aggies working to raise understanding of God's love and justice for the poor and marginalized.

We work on campus and around the BCS area to: promote awareness of modern slavery, foster a community understanding, and raise funds for IJM's work around the world.

We conduct events all year round and accept members on a roling basis. Visit our website for more information on who we are and what our work on campus looks like at: ijmtamu.wix.com/ijmtamu
summary: International Justice Mission (IJM) is a non-profit organization which works globally to help provide justice for the poor. The Texas A&M chapter of IJM, is a group of socially conscious Aggies who work to raise understanding of God's love for the poor.
